subject: Management
title: Boundary Spanners
description: A micro-lesson that makes Boundary Spanners usable.

hook.text: One engineer attended both product and design meetings. She became the most influential person in both.

buildup.text: Boundary spanners are people who bridge different groups, translating between their languages and norms.

discovery.text: Network research: boundary spanners drive innovation because they connect otherwise isolated ideas.

twist.text: These people are rarely in leadership roles. They're often informal connectors nobody formally recognizes.

climax.text: Identify your boundary spanners. Protect their time. Reward their bridging work explicitly.

punchline.text: The person connecting two silos is worth more than either silo knows.

quiz.question: What role do boundary spanners play in organizations?
options: They bridge different groups and drive innovation by connecting isolated ideas
They enforce policies consistently across all departments
They are senior leaders who oversee multiple departments
